attributes.action: give back the £68m that the DTI took from the Research Councils.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As recently reported, the DTI has withdrawn £68m earmarked for the scientific research councils. This money was "ring-fenced", and the DTI have withdrawn it to fund costs arising from the collapse of the Rover group and for "unexpected increase in support needed to cover British Energy's nuclear liabilities."

Not only is this a major blow to research funding in the UK, it marks an unhealthy precedent, whereby government departments can claw back money they've already promised to one group in order to fund their other failures.

Not only do we petition the PM to return the money, we also would ask for an undertaking that this not happen again.

This issue has been covered by both the BBC and the Guardian.
